content:
The discussion definitely deepened my understanding of the book, especially when it came to the characters' motivations and the themes of identity, love, and ambition. The blogger's questions and insights were thought-provoking, and I appreciated how she encouraged us to think critically about the novel.

One thing that stuck with me was her observation about Evelyn's character development throughout the book. She pointed out how Evelyn's experiences shaped her into the person she became, and how her relationships with her husbands reflected different aspects of her personality. It was a great reminder that characters are complex and multifaceted, just like people in real life.

What about you? Have you read "The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo" or any other books by Taylor Jenkins Reid?
